meanings.definition: The amount that a van can hold.
meanings.sent1: The vanload of boxes barely fit in the vehicle.
meanings.sent2: The movers unloaded the vanload of furniture at the new house.
meanings.sent3: The vanload of balloons made the birthday party extra festive.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a vanload of joy that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The vanload of memories brought tears to her eyes.

meanings.sent1: We unloaded the vanload of groceries into the pantry.
meanings.sent2: The vanload of tools was neatly organized in the back of the vehicle.
meanings.sent3: The vanload of clowns spilled out of the tiny car, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a vanload of thoughts racing in different directions.
meanings.sent5: The vanload of books on the shelf caught her eye immediately.

meanings.definition: To fill a van with goods.
meanings.sent1: They will vanload the supplies for the camping trip tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She vanloads the packages carefully to ensure nothing gets damaged.
meanings.sent3: He tried to vanload all his worries into the back of the van and drive them away.
meanings.sent4: The students vanload their backpacks with books before heading to class.
meanings.sent5: The workers vanload the crates onto the truck with precision.
